description:
[Bok choy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bok_choy)  is aleafy green vegetable similar to Chinese broccoli.

**Characters**

{白} is *white*, and {菜} is *vegetable*, so {白菜} is *white vegetable*.

[Bok choy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bok_choy) is usually {小白菜} *small* or *baby* bok choy, or {上海白菜} “Shanghai” bok choy, as opposed to {大白菜} *big* bok choy, otherwise known as Chinese or [Napa cabbage](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Napa_cabbage).

images.place: Chef Ching's Kitchen, Las Vegas, Nevada

description:
[Bok choy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bok_choy) [stir-fried](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stir_frying) with mushrooms.

**Characters**

[冬菇](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E5%86%AC%E8%8F%87) is *winter mushroom* (a high-grade [shiitake](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shiitake)), and [白菜](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E7%99%BD%E8%8F%9C) is *bok choy* (literally *white vegetable*).

[Taiwanese cabbage](https://thewoksoflife.com/chinese-ingredients-glossary/chinese-vegetables-asian-leafy-greens/#Taiwanese-cabbage) are large and somewhat flat, so they are also listed as [flat cabbage](https://www.tainongseeds.com/cabbage-flat-types/).

**Characters**

[高麗](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E9%AB%98%E9%BA%97) is a [loanword](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Loanword) for [kool](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/kool#Dutch), which is Dutch for *cabbage*. [菜](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E8%8F%9C) is *vegetable*, so think *kool kabbage*.
